member.name: P:ProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.FastaFileOptionsClass.LookForAddnlRefInDescription
member.summary: When true, look for additional references in the protein description

member.name: F:ProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.clsProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.PROTEIN_LINE_START_CHAR
member.summary: Each protein description line in the FASTA file should start with a > symbol

member.name: F:ProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.clsProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.PROTEIN_LINE_ACCESSION_TERMINATOR

member.name: M:ProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.clsProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.FindMatchingMotifs(System.IO.StreamWriter@,System.Boolean,ProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.clsProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.udtProteinInfoType@,System.String,System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex@)
member.summary: Search the Sequence in udtProtein for each motif in strMotif or reMotif
member.param: File to write out the results
If True, then writing to a delimited text file; otherwise, writing to a .Fasta file
Text to find (case-sensitive); if blank, will use reMotif
Regular expression to use (only used if strMotif is blank)

member.name: M:ProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.clsProteinSequenceMotifExtractor.ParseProteinFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Search for mMotif in file strProteinInputFilePath The output file will be created in strOutputFolderPath (or the same folder as strProteinInputFilePath if strOutputFolderPath is empty)
